Energy Lab

The Energy Lab is the Space Impact Forum’s dedicated hub for sustainable energy systems and climate-aligned innovation. By leveraging satellite data, advanced analytics, and cross-sector expertise, we develop actionable solutions that accelerate clean energy adoption, optimise grids, and enhance energy security and efficiency worldwide.

  1. Home
  2. Energy Lab

Mission

Energy Impact Labs tackle critical challenges in global energy systems. By bringing together expertise from utilities, renewables, policy, and sustainability sectors, Labs co-create solutions to enhance energy access, reduce carbon emissions, and improve system resilience and efficiency.

Key Challenges

Grid Resilience & Reliability

Ensuring stable, adaptable electricity systems in the face of climate events, cyber threats, and demand fluctuations.

Decarbonisation & Emissions Reduction

Transitioning to low-carbon energy sources, reducing GHG emissions, and integrating renewables effectively.

Energy Access & Equity

Providing reliable, affordable energy to underserved communities while addressing social and geographic disparities.

Renewable Integration

Optimising the deployment and management of solar, wind, hydro, and emerging clean energy technologies.

Efficiency & Demand Management

Reducing energy waste, enhancing demand-response capabilities, and improving system efficiency across sectors.

Policy & Regulatory Gaps

Creating standards, incentives, and governance frameworks that accelerate sustainable energy adoption.

Methodology

Scoping & Research
  • Map systemic energy challenges and define priority problems
  • Engage stakeholders for context and insight
  • Set measurable success indicators and risk assessments
Formation & Onboarding
  • Recruit multidisciplinary Working Group
  • Establish governance, roles, and communication channels
  • Brief participants on methodology, ToC, LogFrame, and measurement
Co-Design Workshops
  • Facilitate systems mapping, opportunity identification, and scenario planning
  • Analyse barriers, enablers, and potential impacts
  • Prioritise intervention pathways and draft prototypes
Prototyping & Validation
  • Develop pilots, technical models, and policy frameworks
  • Test feasibility, stakeholder acceptance, and impact potential
  • Refine solutions based on feedback and IRL assessment
Publication & Dissemination
  • Create reports, toolkits, policy briefs, and dashboards
  • Share via webinars, panels, and SIF channels
  • Engage regulators and industry for adoption
Implementation & Scaling
  • Establish follow-on consortia and partnerships
  • Identify funding pathways and pilot opportunities
  • Support scale-up and monitoring of outcomes

Participants

Energy Utilities & Grid Operators

Contribute practical expertise in managing electricity networks and integrating renewables.

Clean Energy Startups

Provide innovative solutions for generation, storage, smart grids, and efficiency technologies.

Researchers & Academics

Experts in energy systems, climate science, and policy research providing evidence-based insights.

Policy & Regulators

Government agencies ensuring alignment with energy standards, climate targets, and sustainability goals.

Investors & NGOs

Support funding, scaling, and social/environmental impact outcomes across energy projects.

Cross-Sector Partners

Collaborators from technology, infrastructure, sustainability, and policy organisations.

Expected Outcomes

Pilots & Proof-of-Concepts

Operational models, microgrids, and pilot projects addressing energy system challenges.

Policy & Regulatory Guidance

Evidence-based policy briefs, regulatory recommendations, and compliance frameworks.

Sustainability Toolkits

Standards, dashboards, and tools for clean energy adoption and efficiency improvements.

Partnerships & Collaboration

Consortia, MoUs, and data-sharing agreements to accelerate impact.

Research & Insights

Publications, datasets, and case studies supporting evidence-based energy interventions.

Scale-Up Strategies

Implementation roadmaps, funding proposals, and pilot plans for wide adoption.

Take Action with Energy Impact Labs

Drive the clean energy transition. Collaborate as a contributor, technical partner, data provider, sponsor, or observer to co-create solutions, pilot innovations, and deliver measurable impact across energy access, decarbonisation, and system resilience.

Join a Lab Today
